text: The eastern black-and-white colobus monkey, or mantled gueraza (Colobus guereza) is a species of monkey.Groves, Colin; Wilson D.E. and Reeder D.M. (eds) 2005. Mammal species of the world. 3rd ed, Johns Hopkins University Press, pp. 151-152. It can be as big as over long (excluding tail) and up to . In the wild, they live about 20 years. Colobus monkeys are vegetarian. They have a three-chambered stomach to help digest leaves. == References == Category:Mammals of Africa Category:Old World monkeys
title: Eastern black-and-white colobus
